data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهَ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
The word يُحِبُّ comes from the root ح ب ب and is associated with the meanings: To love, like, wish.

data.meanings: to kill, put to death, be accused, slay/murder/kill/slaughter, attempt to kill, render person like to one killed, to wage war/combat/battle, to master, contend/fight, deadly, knew a thing thoroughly/well, become acquainted with it.
data.sentence: The word يُقَاتِلُونَ comes from the root ق ت ل and is associated with the meanings: to kill, put to death, be accused, slay/murder/kill/slaughter, attempt to kill, render person like to one killed, to wage war/combat/battle, to master, contend/fight, deadly, knew a thing thoroughly/well, become acquainted with it.

data.meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.
data.sentence: The word سَبِيلِهِ comes from the root س ب ل and is associated with the meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.

data.meanings: evenly, side by side, laid out, a rank/row/line, in order, with reference to a bird: extend its wings in a line, expand/spread its wings (i.e. not flapping).
data.sentence: The word صَفًّا comes from the root ص ف ف and is associated with the meanings: evenly, side by side, laid out, a rank/row/line, in order, with reference to a bird: extend its wings in a line, expand/spread its wings (i.e. not flapping).

data.meanings: to cement or join together, make compact, stack, overlay with lead. trassa - to close ranks. arassa - having the teeth close together.
data.sentence: The word مَرْصُوصٌ comes from the root ر ص ص and is associated with the meanings: to cement or join together, make compact, stack, overlay with lead. trassa - to close ranks. arassa - having the teeth close together.
